title: JAPANESE UDON RESTAURANT - Chef Assistant
description:
**Overview**  
Azuki is the passion project of Owner and Head Chef Ryuji Miyata, or as we call him "Chef". The core of the restaurant is the handmade noodles which Chef crafts daily, as well as the dashi soup our team creates over the course of two days. We are looking for assistants for the prepping and serving process of our noodle house.

**Responsibilities**

* During closed hours \- weighing out portions, prepping ingredients for cooking and topping, cleaning
* During open hours \- listening to incoming orders, gathering the requires ingredients, prepping them, and providing them to chef so he can prepare the final meal.

**Qualifications**

* Previous experience in food service, restaurant work, or culinary settings is preferred but not required; a strong interest in Japanese cuisine is a plus
* Decent Knife skills
* Knowledge of Japanese culture, ingredients, cuisine, and preferably language (even surface level Japanese language will help immensely.
* Ability to work in a small, fast paced kitchen.

This position is not customer facing, though if you choose opportunities for front positions will become available.

Join our team to gain hands\-on culinary experience in authentic Japanese cuisine while contributing to an exceptional dining experience for our guests.

Pay: $28\.26 \- $34\.03 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Paid training

Work Location: In person

title: Store Attendant
description:
**【Job Description****】**

* Operation of Arcade game machines, such as replenishing prizes, cleaning the machines, and managing prize inventory (including reporting the inventory every three months)
* Customer Support
* Simple maintenance of arcade game machines
* Submitting online report with pictures to headquarters by smartphone app
* Cash counting and depositing to the nearest bank
* Other simple tasks (Machine cleaning, floor cleaning) will be requested
* You will work alone as HQ supports you online
* Japanese\-speaker preferred

**【Hourly rate****】**

* **$17\.27/h\~**

**【Location****】**

* Culver City, CA 90230

**【Start Time****】**

* ASAP

**【Work Days****】**

* Monday – Sunday: 9AM\-1PM, 1PM – 5PM, 5PM – 9PM (Flexible and open to negotiation)
* Available for 2\-3 shifts per week

**【General Work Hours****】**

* Monday – Sunday: 9AM\-1PM, 1PM – 5PM, 5PM – 9PM (Flexible and open to negotiation)
* Available for 2\-3 shifts per week
* We welcome students! We will support you until you get used to the work!

**【仕事内容】**

* 景品の補充と景品の在庫管理。接客業務。３か月に一度の棚卸。現金管理。お掃除。その他の簡単な作業をお願いする場合があります。

**【勤務地】**開始予定日：即日

* Culver City, CA 90230

**【勤務日】**

  

* 月曜日から日曜日: 午前中、午後、夕方 （柔軟で、交渉可能 週に二、三回のシフトが可能です。

 **【勤務時間】**

* 月曜日から日曜日: 午前中、午後、夕方 （柔軟で、交渉可能 週に二、三回のシフトが可能です。
* 学生の方も歓迎します！仕事に慣れるまでサポートします！

 **【時給】**

* $17\.27～


Job Type: Part\-time


Pay: $17\.27 per hour


License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)


Ability to Commute:

* Culver City, CA 90230 (Required)


Work Location: In person


If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

 **GENDA Americas** is the North American hub of **GENDA**, a global leader in amusement and entertainment. Our mission is simple: to create joy, deliver value, and strengthen communities by investing in and growing leading entertainment brands across Canada and USA. **GENDA Americas** companies include:

* **Kiddleton**: Bringing kawaii\-inspired claw machines and IP\-driven prizes to arcades, high\-traffic entertainment venues, and retail locations across the U.S. and Canada.
* **Player One Amusement Group (P1AG):** One of North America’s leading arcade operators and amusement solutions providers, offering revenue\-share partnerships, new game distribution, and route operations.
* **National Entertainment Network (NEN):** The largest amusement vending operator in the U.S., delivering crane machines, kiddie rides, and bulk vending across thousands of retail locations.
* **Enterrium**: Schaumburg's premier entertainment hub, where modern dining meets classic arcade thrills. Experience the thrill of bowling on our eight boutique lanes, or gather friends and family for private events in our stylish, upscale venue.
* **Barberio**: A long\-standing leader in amusement and jukebox operations, expanding entertainment offerings in community spaces.

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.*

*Employment is contingent upon the candidate’s authorization to work in the United States; the company participates in E\-Verify. The Company does not provide visa sponsorship.*

*Offers of employment may be contingent upon the successful completion of background checks and/or other pre\-employment requirements, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.*

*Applicants requiring a reasonable accommodation to participate in the application or interview process should notify the Company.*

*The Company does not accept unsolicited submissions from recruiting or staffing agencies, and no fees will be paid.*

title: Japanese speaking barber needed
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a skilled Japanese\-speaking barber to join our dynamic barbershop team. The ideal candidate will possess a passion for hair styling and grooming, with the ability to communicate effectively in Japanese. This role offers an exciting opportunity to serve a diverse clientele, providing expert barbering services while delivering exceptional customer experiences. The successful applicant will be responsible for maintaining high standards of sanitation, utilizing advanced skills in hair cutting, and styling, and contributing to the overall store management and client satisfaction.

**Duties**

* Perform professional barbering services including haircuts and grooming tailored to client Apply
* Manage front desk responsibilities including greeting clients, scheduling appointments, and assisting with retail product sales.
* Maintain strict sanitation and cleanliness standards in accordance with health regulations .
* Stay updated on current trends in hair styling and grooming techniques to provide innovative services.

**Requirements**

* Proven experience as a barber with proficiency in traditional and modern haircutting techniques.
* Fluent in Japanese with excellent communication
* Strong understanding of sanitation practices within a barbershop environment.
* Background in cosmetology or barbering certification/license required.
* Ability to work efficiently while maintaining attention to detail during high\-volume periods.
* Excellent customer service skills with a friendly and professional demeanor.
* Experience in retail sales and upselling techniques to promote products and services.
* Capable of renting own station and contributing positively to store management activities. Join our team and bring your expertise in barbering combined with your passion for delivering outstanding service in a vibrant environment!

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $24\.02 \- $28\.93 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Opportunities for advancement

Work Location: In person

1 server/ multi- tasking runner/busser/host
description:
**Job Overview**  
Join our vibrant team as a Server, where you’ll play a crucial role in delivering exceptional dining experiences in this Japanese Restaurant! You will engage with guests, take orders, and ensure that every meal is served with a smile. Your passion for hospitality and dedication to customer service will shine as you create memorable moments for our patrons in a dynamic environment.

Ton Shou is also looking for a reliable and energetic Busser/Food Runner to join our team. This role supports servers and kitchen staff by clearing and resetting tables, running food promptly and accurately, refilling water, and helping keep the dining room clean and organized. The ideal candidate is fast\-paced, team\-oriented, attentive to detail, and able to provide friendly service in a busy restaurant environment. Prior restaurant experience is a plus, but not required. Must be able to stand for long periods and lift trays as needed.

We are seeking an experienced Hostess who brings a warm, professional personality and polished appearance to our front\-of\-house team. The ideal candidate understands that first impressions matter and takes pride in creating a welcoming atmosphere for every guest. She must be hardworking, reliable, and confident in multitasking—managing reservations, greeting and seating guests promptly, coordinating with servers, and maintaining an organized flow during busy service hours. A strong awareness of business goals is essential, recognizing that efficient seating and attentive guest service directly impact customer satisfaction and overall restaurant success. This role requires someone who thrives in a fast\-paced environment while maintaining composure, positivity, and exceptional hospitality at all times.

**What you’ll do**

* Greet and seat guests with enthusiasm, ensuring they feel welcomed from the moment they arrive.
* Take accurate food and beverage orders using Aloha POS or Micros POS systems, ensuring all requests are met promptly.
* Provide knowledgeable recommendations on menu items, showcasing your culinary expertise and upselling specials to enhance guest satisfaction.
* Maintain cleanliness and organization of the dining area, including bussing tables and adhering to sanitation standards.
* Collaborate with kitchen staff to ensure timely food preparation and delivery while managing multiple tables efficiently.
* Handle cash transactions accurately, utilizing basic math skills for effective cashiering.
* Address guest inquiries and concerns with professionalism, fostering positive guest relations throughout their visit.
* Assist in training new staff members, sharing your knowledge of food service best practices and restaurant operations.

**Basic qualifications**

* Previous experience in Japanese food service or restaurant environments is essential.
* Strong time management skills to handle busy shifts effectively.

**Preferred qualifications**

* Experience with Yelp Guest Manager for reservations/ waitlist management is a plus.
* Familiarity with fine dining standards and guest services enhances your ability to excel in this role.
* Knowledge of food handling and safety regulations to ensure compliance within the kitchen environment.

**Why you’ll love it here**  
We are dedicated to creating an uplifting workplace where our team members can thrive both personally and professionally! Enjoy the perks of working in a lively atmosphere that values your contributions.

**Our benefits include:**

* A supportive team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.
* Opportunities for growth within the organization through training programs.
* Employee discounts on meals to enjoy our delicious offerings!

Job Types: Full\-time, Part\-time

Pay: From $12\.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Referral program

Work Location: In person

As the demand for Remote Interpreting Services (RIS) continues to grow, we are excited to extend this freelance opportunity to you.


We are currently seeking USA Based Over the phone interpreters (OPI) who speak both **Japanese** and English fluently. This is a REMOTE freelance position.


\*\*\*\*\*\*OVER THE PHONE INTERPRETER OPPORTUNITIES! USA based only\*\*\*\*\*

  

Requirements:

  

* Have informal or professional interpretation experience
* Are fluent in both **Japanese** and English.
* Successfully complete the language professional onboarding process ***and*** testing if required.
* You will need high speed internet connection and computer/laptop
* As times have changed interpretation is now done via a soft phone which requires an interpreter to log in via computer using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox Browser. By logging in using a computer as an interpreter you can service both video and audio calls. No phones allowed.
* As a contractual interpreter you can log in both weekdays and weekends during various hours (no standby rates are offered).
* Experience in the healthcare industry experience is preferred, although not required (for example, pharmacy tech/pharmacist, nursing home, hospital, hospice, patient tech, practicum hours as part of a nursing program, pharmaceutical rep, CNA, LVN, RN, volunteering at a hospital, etc.).


We look forward to working with you soon!

title: Tour Leader- Japan
description:
Japan\-Based \| Recruitment Opens now for 2026\.


**Why Join Us?**


**Are you passionate about travel and ready to make the world your office?**  

If you’re a natural problem solver, calm under pressure, organised, and love delivering outstanding customer service, then a career as a Tour Leader could be your perfect fit!  

  

We are expanding our team and seeking passionate, professional, and energetic **Japan Tour Leaders** to guide our passengers through this fascinating destination.  

  

As a Tour Leader, you’ll be the heart and face of our brand, creating unforgettable moments for guests, from spontaneous laughs to awe\-inspiring landscapes. This is more than a job, it’s a vocation for those passionate about travel and hosting.  

  

**What we’re looking for:**


* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Strong organisational and time management abilities
* Previous Tour Leader or Local Guide experience
* Confident leadership and team management skills
* Solid accounting and money\-handling foundations
* Strong research skills for destinations and itineraries
* Good knowledge of Japan — culture, geography, and travel logistics.
* High level of English proficiency (additional languages an advantage)
* Japanese language skills are highly advantageous, but not essential
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team
* A proactive, “solutions\-before\-problems” mindset

Ideally based in Japan or nearby, but not essential  
* 

**You’ll Bring:**


* **Passion \& Energy** – Bring destinations to life with enthusiasm, warmth, and storytelling that sparks connection.
* **Organisation \& Calm** – Juggle logistics, unexpected changes, and guest needs with poise and efficiency.
* **Leadership \& Empathy** – Be a guide, friend, and problem\-solver—turning groups of strangers into tight\-knit travel families.
* **Knowledge \& Responsiveness** – Know local gems, customs, transport, and cultural quirks. You'll also assist guests with practical needs like logistics or emergencies.
* **Professionalism Under Pressure** – Handle change with grace, while maintaining a fun, inclusive, and safe environment for everyone.
  


**Responsibilities at a Glance:**


* Deliver engaging narrative led introductions and destination insights.
* Manage on tour logistics, transport, accommodation, timings, liaising with suppliers to coordinate and reconfirm bookings on our multi day tours
* Serve as the go to support for guests \- personally, socially, and operationally.
* Lead with energy, even under pressure, and resolve issues calmly and creatively.
* Maintain group morale and ensure every guest feels included and informed.
* Day to day accounting.  

  

**What you’ll gain:**
* Compensation \- Competitive day rate along with additional earnable incentives and gratuities. Tipping is encouraged but not mandatory.
* Some living expenses are covered during a tour (accommodation, breakfast and some dinners)
* Get paid to explore exciting destinations and be part of the best road crew in Europe.
* Meet new people from around the world
* Tour Leader Accommodation is provided in private rooms on tour. We also provide one night of pre tour accommodation or an allowance to use towards this depending on the tour itinerary
* Daily allowance given for use of personal phone and data on tour
* Discounts on personal travel with the company.
* Uniform and training provided.
* Online support with tour slack channels to keep contact with the office and help support or answer any issues you may have on the road
* Emergency line to contact at any hour for support if needed

  


**Recruitment Details:**


**Recruitment for Tour Leader positions based in the Japan open now for 2026\.**  

  

**Please attach your CV, a cover letter or description of why you would like to join our company as a Tour Leader**

title: Sous Chef
description:
Employee Benefit


* Medical, dental, vision insurance.
* Paid time off and holidays.
* 401k Plan available after worked eligible hours.

  

**Essential Job Functions:**


* Job Location is at: Japan Pavilion in EPCOT.
* Develop or modify menu items with approval of Culinary Control Budget.
* Adhere Company Direction of recipes, responsible for food quality and presentation, collaborates with Culinary Administration to develop the menu. (Collaborate with head chef on new menu creation)
* Assess the kitchen staff for a daily shift, work\-schedule as maximizing operation efficiency and decreasing labor cost.
* Approve employee's schedules, hours and timesheets for Cook I, II \& III
* Adhere to the sanitation standards in the kitchen as required by WDWC, the Company and the HACCP Program, also execute to maintain accurate record\-keeping which is required by the HACCP program.
* Adhere to the Company food handling, food preparation and cooking standards, and safety directives by Safety Officer and Facility Management.
* Ensure you provide instructions on food quality and cooking skills to Cook I, II and III, and provide them with regular feedback and coaching.
* Evaluation support for head chef regarding Cook I, II and III cooking skills, behavior, attitude and compliance with corporate rules.
* Jump in operation and prepare food menu items at cooking when it’s required as the service becomes behind and there is an emergency shortage of the number of cooks.
* Assist in other areas as needed by business. Assist with Cook I, II \& III lunch break rotation.
* Pay careful attention and calculate the food cost (%), labor cost (%), and kitchen productivity, inventory; work with Culinary Administration to improve.
* Ensure preparation of inventory by aligning with Purchase and Culinary Administration to organize kitchen and food storage areas, all the equipment, tools and cooling units to be secured and functioning properly.
* At management request, train and manage a supervisor and workers of the contract service when a new menu item or new preparation method is introduced.
* Determine what information, skills, and/or training are needed and do the necessary training. Inform Culinary Administration of Training
* Build skill test with Manager of Culinary Administration and HR. Administer skill test for promotions for Cook Department.
* When the head chef is not available, ensure operations are up to par while communicating with the chef about any issues with workers, guests or equipment.
* Assist with Butchering Meat and Fish Cut as necessary.


**Other Job Functions:**


* Estimate and schedules volume of food preparation for efficiency to meet with anticipated number of guests. Control excess and waste.
* Execute the opening/closing of the kitchen which include:
* Pre\-shift meeting with production
* Take temperatures.
* Receive and check the quality of food deliveries.
* Take banquet and sushi orders and schedule with advanced employees.
* Review Invoice for sushi/banquet orders.
* Create and prepare Happy meal menu/ Employee meal menu.



**Physical****Effort****:**


* Must be able to lift 40 lbs.
* Sitting
* Standing
* Lifting
* Walking
* Seeing
* Reaching
* Able to smell and identify odor.


**Working****Conditions****:**


* Moderate Noise
* Restaurant environment

  


**Qualifications:**


* Five years of experience in a restaurant business; or
* Three years of experience in Cook Dept. at Mitsukoshi.
* Culinary certificate or diploma preferred.
* Bi\-lingual in Japanese, preferred.
* Understanding of Japanese Cuisine, preferred


**Other Qualifications:**


* Able to multi\-task with competing priorities and meet deadlines in a face pace environment.
* Able to work weekends and/or holidays as required.
* Able to communicate in English with supervisors, colleagues, and individuals inside and outside the company.
* Able to work effectively and relate well with others.
* Able to do basic arithmetic which includes subtraction, addition, division, multiplication and counting of items. The employee must also be able to analyze and solve simple problems.
* Able to read and comprehend written information.

**Job Summary:**



Report to Executive Chef and assist and collaborate with Chef to ensure all Company’s culinary goals are met.



Mitsukoshi USA provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.



Mitsukoshi USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Airport Passenger Service Agent - JAL - JFK
description:
**N.B.:** INTERVIEWS BY APPOINTMENTS ONLY. NO WALK\-INS ACCEPTED.
  
  

AS PER MANAGER'S REQUEST, AN UPLOADED RESUME IS REQUIRED WITH YOUR APPLICATION.
  
  

Passenger Service Agents are the first line of defense for our customers! This is a customer\-facing role, providing first\-class customer service to everyone. You are friendly, outgoing, and love to make people happy daily!
  
  

Responsibilities
  
* Assist passengers with a smile and friendly face through arrival and check\-in process, including support for passengers with special needs such as unaccompanied minors, VIP passengers and passengers needing wheelchair assistance.
* Handle all aspects of arrival and departure functions, ticketing, gate handling and check\-in by operating a computerized system. System usage includes boarding, baggage service, reservations and resolving related complaints and problems such as lost and found issues.
* Perform customer relations, duties and responsibilities which includes providing information for airline passengers regarding their travelling needs and assisting them with special requests and considerations.
* Ability to handle passport/VISA documentation.
* Ability to interact with all levels of individuals such as passengers, employees, customers, corporate representatives and the general public.


Qualifications
  
  

* Fluency in Japanese, Filipino, Vietnamese, Indonesian OR Chinese is a requirement.
* Ability to showcase exceptional customer service abilities to all cliental.
* Must be able to walk, climb, bend, kneel, crawl, and stoop on a frequent basis and for extended periods.
* Must be able to lift/carry / push/pull and move items of 70 pounds and/or more on a regular basis and repetitively lift weights of 40 to 50 pounds on raised surfaces.
* Able to work in extreme conditions, such as hot and cold weather, as well as small spaces.
* Flexible schedule allowing work during nights, weekends, and holidays.

title: Business Analytics Senior Consultant
description:
**Count on us.** Our "we\-care" culture is more than just a motto; it's a promise. From day one, we prioritize your growth, well\-being, and success. You can count on us to support your career journey and help you achieve your professional goals. Join us.

**Your role.**


Your work may include, but not be limited to:

* Gathering requirements from client stakeholders
* Architecting client data and analytics environments
* Designing, developing, and deploying data warehouses
* Performing advanced SQL scripting and data engineering
* Facilitating the conceptual/logical data modeling process
* Developing advanced ETL processes and data pipelines
* Performing API integration, deployment, and support
* Developing and deploying reports and BI solutions
* Mentoring and coaching less experienced staff
* Participating in firm/client innovation projects
* Supporting practice development activities
* Supporting project management

**The qualifications.**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* 2\+ years of experience with data engineering and analytics deployment
* Demonstrated ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical challenges
* Ability to manage multiple concurrent projects and data development projects
* Hands\-on experience SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Fabric or similar ETL technologies
* Cloud data platform experience (Fabric, Synapse, AWS Redshift, Snowflake, Databricks)
* Experience configuring, deploying, and or administering a cloud data platform is desired
* Experience working within DevOps CI/CD tools and processes is desired (ADO, GitHub, dbt)
* Strong SQL skills (e.g. stored procedures, CTEs, window functions, DDL / DML)
* Experience developing and deploying Python ETL scripts and APIs a plus
* Experience construction and / or manufacturing industry a plus
* Microsoft SQL Server / Azure / Fabric certification(s) a plus
* Experience developing reports in BI tool
* Approximately \< 20% overnight travel


This is an exempt position, so you may have to work hours that exceed the standard 40\-hour work week.

**What makes us different?**


On the surface, we’re one of the nation’s largest audit, tax, consulting, and wealth management firms. But dig a little deeper, and you’ll see what makes us different: we’re a relatively jerk\-free firm (hey, nobody ‘s perfect) with a world\-class culture, consistent recognition as one of Fortune Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” and an endless array of opportunities. At Plante Moran, diversity, equity and inclusion means that all staff members have equitable and fair opportunities to succeed, in an inclusive environment, with their individual, unique identities. So, what are you waiting for? Apply now.

*Plante Moran enjoys a “Workplace for Your Day” model which, simply put, means we strive for flexibility and balance while staying true to our principally in\-person model. We believe that face\-to\-face interactions are paramount for individual and collective development, but also encourage individuals to work with their supervisor and team to determine their optimal working environment each day.*

*Plante Moran is committed to a diverse workplace. We strive to create a culture where each person feels accepted and valued. We believe that each person’s ultimate potential begins with first acknowledging their inherent dignity. When we can recognize — and celebrate — our many human differences, we’re able to create a workplace where all staff feel a sense of belonging and an opportunity to succeed. This allows us to attract and retain the best talent, serve clients through diverse thinking, and better represent and support the various communities in which we live and work. Plante Moran is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

*Plante Moran maintains a drug\-free workplace.*

*Interested applicants must submit their resume for consideration using our applicant tracking system. Due to the high volume of interest in our positions, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship, with the exception of qualified candidates who are bilingual in either Japanese and English or Chinese and English. Unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, or similar, will not be paid a fee and become the property of Plante Moran.*

 *The specific statements above are not intended to be all\-inclusive.*


We are pleased to offer eligible staff a robust benefits package. Eligibility and contribution requirements for some of these benefits vary based on the number of hours staff work per week. Highlights include health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. In addition to this, eligible staff are able to take advantage of our Flexible Time Off and various pre\-determined holidays, as well as a 401(k) plan, flexible benefits plans, business\-related travel expense, lodging, and meal reimbursement for business\-related use. A pension plan is also available for eligible administrative and paraprofessional staff. A discretionary bonus plan is available for eligible staff. Plante Moran also offers some contingent staff positions the option to elect health insurance in addition to limited paid sick time.


The compensation range reflects the base salary we reasonably expect to pay for this position across our offices in the following regions: CO, IL, OH, and MA. Please review the position description for the applicable geographic location. Generally, experienced hires are not hired at or near the maximum salary range, as compensation decisions take into account a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to: responsibilities, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and geography. For early career roles, including campus hires, we offer standardized, market\-based starting salaries among individuals within the same hiring group. This approach ensures fairness and reflects current industry benchmarks for entry\-level talent.


Under Colorado’s Job Application Fairness Act, you have the right to redact, from any documents that you submit in connection with your application, information that identifies your age, date of birth, or dates of attendance at or graduation from an educational institution. Should you wish to exercise your right to redact such information, please redact it prior to submitting documentation.


The compensation range for this role in CO, IL, OH, and MA is: $90,000\.00 \- $120,000\.00

title: Hiring Cafe Floor Manager / ACRE Japanese cafe restaurant
description:
**About ACRE**  
ACRE is a Japanese café and restaurant located in Greenpoint, Brooklyn. We serve nourishing and simple Japanese meals, while also offering a selection of Japanese tableware and lifestyle goods in our retail section. Our mission is to enrich people’s lives through healthy, thoughtful, and comforting food.

**Position: Cafe / Floor Manager**  
We are seeking a motivated and reliable Cafe / Floor Manager to oversee café, floor, and retail operations. This role is ideal for someone passionate about hospitality who enjoys working with a team and is eager to grow with us while learning about Japanese cuisine and culture.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with the management team to oversee café, floor, and retail operations
* Lead and motivate staff members to ensure a positive guest experience throughout the café and retail space
* Manage schedules, shift coverage, and daily task assignments
* Assist in staff training, onboarding, and performance support
* Foster a professional, positive, and team\-oriented work environment

**Qualifications:**

* Experience in a café, restaurant, or hospitality environment (management experience not required)
* Espresso machine/barista experience is highly preferred
* Eagerness to learn and gain hands\-on management experience
* Positive attitude and willingness to grow together with the team
* Interest in Japanese cuisine and culture is a plus
* Flexible availability, including weekends and holidays
* Detail\-oriented, conscientious and organized.
* Being able to speak Japanese will be a huge plus

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $60,000\.00 \- $65,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* Employee discount

Work Location: In person

title: Tour Leader- Japan
description:
Japan\-Based \| Recruitment Opens now for 2026\.


**Why Join Us?**


**Are you passionate about travel and ready to make the world your office?**  

If you’re a natural problem solver, calm under pressure, organised, and love delivering outstanding customer service, then a career as a Tour Leader could be your perfect fit!  

  

We are expanding our team and seeking passionate, professional, and energetic **Japan Tour Leaders** to guide our passengers through this fascinating destination.  

  

As a Tour Leader, you’ll be the heart and face of our brand, creating unforgettable moments for guests, from spontaneous laughs to awe\-inspiring landscapes. This is more than a job, it’s a vocation for those passionate about travel and hosting.  

  

**What we’re looking for:**


* Excellent customer service and communication skills
* Strong organisational and time management abilities
* Previous Tour Leader or Local Guide experience
* Confident leadership and team management skills
* Solid accounting and money\-handling foundations
* Strong research skills for destinations and itineraries
* Good knowledge of Japan — culture, geography, and travel logistics.
* High level of English proficiency (additional languages an advantage)
* Japanese language skills are highly advantageous, but not essential
* Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team
* A proactive, “solutions\-before\-problems” mindset

Ideally based in Japan or nearby, but not essential  
* 

**You’ll Bring:**


* **Passion \& Energy** – Bring destinations to life with enthusiasm, warmth, and storytelling that sparks connection.
* **Organisation \& Calm** – Juggle logistics, unexpected changes, and guest needs with poise and efficiency.
* **Leadership \& Empathy** – Be a guide, friend, and problem\-solver—turning groups of strangers into tight\-knit travel families.
* **Knowledge \& Responsiveness** – Know local gems, customs, transport, and cultural quirks. You'll also assist guests with practical needs like logistics or emergencies.
* **Professionalism Under Pressure** – Handle change with grace, while maintaining a fun, inclusive, and safe environment for everyone.
  


**Responsibilities at a Glance:**


* Deliver engaging narrative led introductions and destination insights.
* Manage on tour logistics, transport, accommodation, timings, liaising with suppliers to coordinate and reconfirm bookings on our multi day tours
* Serve as the go to support for guests \- personally, socially, and operationally.
* Lead with energy, even under pressure, and resolve issues calmly and creatively.
* Maintain group morale and ensure every guest feels included and informed.
* Day to day accounting.  

  

**What you’ll gain:**
* Compensation \- Competitive day rate along with additional earnable incentives and gratuities. Tipping is encouraged but not mandatory.
* Some living expenses are covered during a tour (accommodation, breakfast and some dinners)
* Get paid to explore exciting destinations and be part of the best road crew in Europe.
* Meet new people from around the world
* Tour Leader Accommodation is provided in private rooms on tour. We also provide one night of pre tour accommodation or an allowance to use towards this depending on the tour itinerary
* Daily allowance given for use of personal phone and data on tour
* Discounts on personal travel with the company.
* Uniform and training provided.
* Online support with tour slack channels to keep contact with the office and help support or answer any issues you may have on the road
* Emergency line to contact at any hour for support if needed

  


**Recruitment Details:**


**Recruitment for Tour Leader positions based in the Japan open now for 2026\.**  

  

**Please attach your CV, a cover letter or description of why you would like to join our company as a Tour Leader**

title: Project Manager (Multilingual: Korean, Japanese, English)
description:
At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
Role Overview
Broadridge Financial Solutions is seeking an experienced Project Manager to support the onboarding of new clients in Japan. This role will manage and coordinate end‑to‑end client onboarding activities, working closely with clients, local stakeholders, and global Broadridge teams to ensure a smooth, accurate, and timely transition into steady‑state operations.  

  

The Project Manager will serve as a key point of coordination throughout the onboarding process, ensuring clear communication, regulatory awareness, and alignment with Broadridge’s service standards. This role requires a high level of organization, the ability to operate independently, and a strong commitment to client trust, service reliability, and transparency.
Responsibilities* Own and manage client onboarding projects from initiation through completion, ensuring successful and timely delivery
* Define project scope, milestones, timelines, and deliverables in collaboration with clients and internal stakeholders
* Develop and maintain detailed project plans, schedules, and regular status reporting
* Act as a primary liaison between Japanese clients and global Broadridge teams, providing clear and professional bilingual communication
* Coordinate activities across operations, client services, technology partners, and third‑party vendors, with sensitivity to cultural and organizational contexts
* Monitor project progress, dependencies, risks, and issues, escalating appropriately while maintaining alignment and transparency with stakeholders
* Facilitate project meetings, status reviews, and client communications in both Japanese and English
* Ensure onboarding activities align with applicable regulatory and market requirements, including U.S. proxy regulations
* Maintain accurate and well‑organized project documentation
* Contribute to continuous improvement of onboarding and project management processes


Required Qualifications and Experience* 5\+ years of experience in project management, client onboarding, or client implementation roles within financial services
* Business‑level proficiency in Korean, Japanese, and English (written and verbal communication required)
* Prior experience in one or more of the following areas:
* Proxy voting or shareholder communications
* Custody processing or post‑trade operations systems
* Financial market infrastructure or other regulated environments
* Familiarity with U.S. proxy regulations and related market practices
* Experience working effectively with global teams across multiple time zones
* Strong organizational and planning skills, with the ability to manage multiple workstreams independently while coordinating closely with stakeholders

  

Preferred Qualifications* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, economics, or a related field
* Project management certification preferred (e.g., PMP or PRINCE2\)
* Experience supporting Japanese institutional clients or global asset managers
* Familiarity with Broadridge products, services, or operating model


\#LI\-KA2
\#LI\-Hybrid
We are dedicated to fostering a collaborative, engaging, and inclusive environment and are committed to providing a workplace that empowers associates to be authentic and bring their best to work. We believe that associates do their best when they feel safe, understood, and valued, and we work diligently and collaboratively to ensure Broadridge is a company—and ultimately a community—that recognizes and celebrates everyone’s unique perspective.
Use of AI in Hiring
As part of the recruiting process, Broadridge may use technology, including artificial intelligence (AI)\-based tools, to help review and evaluate applications. These tools are used only to support our recruiters and hiring managers, and all employment decisions include human review to ensure fairness, accuracy, and compliance with applicable laws. Please note that honesty and transparency are critical to our hiring process. Any attempt to falsify, misrepresent, or disguise information in an application, resume, assessment, or interview will result in disqualification from consideration.

title: JFK Passenger Service Agent - All Nippon Airways
description:
**N.B.:** INTERVIEWS BY APPOINTMENT, NO WALK\-INS ALLOWED.
  
  

AS PER MANAGER'S REQUEST, AN UPLOADED RESUME IS REQUIRED WITH YOUR APPLICATION
  
  

JFK PASSENGER SERVICE AGENT
  
  

Passenger Service Agents are the first line of defense for our customers! This is a customer\-facing role, providing first\-class customer service to everyone. You are friendly, outgoing, and love to make people happy daily!
  
  

Responsibilities
  
* Assists passengers with their baggage pick\-up.
* Assists passengers to resolve issues with their delayed, lost, or damaged items.
* Utilizes computer software to track and catalog luggage.
* Handles customer interaction with class in an efficient, effective, and professional manner.
* Performs other related duties as assigned within the appropriate skill and experience capabilities expected for this position.
* Must be able to lift/carry / push/pull and move items of 70 pounds and/or more regularly and repetitively lift weights of 40 to 50 pounds on raised surfaces.


Basic Qualifications
  
  

\*
  
1\-year related experience preferred.
  
\*
  
Bilingual Fluency required \- English along with Japanese, Indonesian, Chinese, Filipino, Tagalog, Mandarin, Indonesian OR Spanish. \* Must be a local (in\-state) resident.
  
* High School diploma or GED.
* Valid State ID
* Successfully pass pre\-employment drug screen and background check.
* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* Must have the authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986\.
* Must complete ramp and SIDA training to obtain airport authority identification security.
* Must be able to carry heavy items up and down jetway stairs.
* Must be able to be alert to moving vehicles or aircraft and use radio equipment.
* Flexible schedule allowing work during nights, weekends, and holidays.


Benefits
  
  

Explore amazing destinations anywhere Delta Air Lines flies through worldwide pass travel privileges.
  
  

Comprehensive Medical / Dental / Vision / Telehealth
  
  

401(k) Retirement Plan
  
  

Have early access to your pay and enjoy competitive interest rates when you purchase white goods through our preferred vendor platforms.Paid Time Off

description:
***Please submit your resume in English and indicate your level of English.***


At Toloka, we connect smart, curious people from around the world with freelance online tasks that train and improve artificial intelligence.


**What we do**


The Toloka Annotators connects individuals with Generative AI projects from leading tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the full potential of AI by involving real people from around the world in the development process.

**About the Role**


Annotation is what helps AI make sense of the world. As an annotator, you may be invited to take part in **online projects** such as rating AI\-generated content, evaluating factual accuracy, or comparing responses — when projects are available.


**Responsibilities:**


* Carefully review provided Japanese\-language data (text, images, or videos)
* Label and classify Japanese content in accordance with project guidelines
* Identify and flag factually incorrect, sensitive, inappropriate, or unclear elements in Japanese materials


This is project\-based work, meaning tasks are available **only when projects are active**. The next project is expected to start in a few weeks. Depending on your profile and current opportunities, you may be invited to participate in one or more projects.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in any discipline
* Minimum **1 year of experience** in any professional role.
* **Proficient in Japanese (C2\) and advanced in English (B2 or higher),** both written and spoken.
* Logical thinking, fact\-checking and reasoning abilities
* Strong attention to detail and ability to understand and follow complex instructions
* Strong communication skills, including the ability to ask clarifying questions when needed
* Genuine interest in technology and artificial intelligence

**Benefits**

**Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?**

* Get paid for your expertise, with **rates that can go up to $23/hour** depending on your skills, experience, location and project needs.
* Take part in a part\-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
* Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
* Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise.

title: Part-Time Japanese Language Instructor (Remote – 1:1 | VR & Video Platform)
description:
**About IMMERSE**
-----------------


IMMERSE is a language learning platform that helps adults build real fluency through live instruction and AI\-powered practice in contextual 3D environments. We provide immersive, high\-quality language instruction designed for real workplace communication. We partner with organizations globally to deliver high\-quality, workplace\-ready language learning that's interactive, practical, and human.


**The Role**
------------


We're hiring part\-time Japanese language instructors to teach 1:1 communicative lessons to adult learners. Sessions take place either on the IMMERSE platform or via video conferencing software, depending on the learner's program and class type.


We're seeking experienced, professionally trained instructors who can confidently guide adult learners through structured, speaking\- and listening\-focused sessions. Your role will be to help learners build confidence and fluency through purposeful, real\-time interaction.


Whether teaching inside the IMMERSE app – using immersive VR environments such as meeting rooms, cafés, and workplace simulations\- or leading live video sessions, you will be expected to deliver:


* High engagement and energy
* Clear lesson structure and pacing
* Strong pedagogical intentionality
* Consistent learner progress toward communicative goals


This is a structured teaching role designed for educators with strong training in language pedagogy, demonstrated experience developing adult learners' speaking and listening skills, and comfort using technology in the classroom.


**Why You'll Love Teaching with IMMERSE**
-----------------------------------------


**Innovative platform:** Teach in immersive VR environments purpose\-built for communicative language development — not generic virtual classrooms.


**Personalized impact:** Work 1:1 with adult learners to meaningfully accelerate their speaking confidence and real\-world fluency.


**Professionally motivated learners:** Teach working professionals sponsored by their companies,


**Pedagogy\-Driven Community:** Collaborate with fellow educators who care deeply about instructional quality, learner progress, and authentic connection.


**Global, Meaningful Work:** Help learners around the world gain the confidence to speak Japanese in professional and everyday settings.


**What We're Looking For**
--------------------------


### **Required Qualifications**


* BA in Japanese Language Education, Applied Linguistics, or a closely related field.  

(If the degree is not directly related, a Japanese language teaching certification and extensive Japanese language teaching experience is required.)

2\+ years of structured Japanese language teaching experience.  
* 

Experience teaching adult learners speaking and listening skills in professional or academic contexts.  
* 

Strong foundation in communicative and task\-based language teaching.  
* 

Demonstrated ability to intentionally develop adult learners' speaking and listening skills (not just follow a textbook).  
* 

Near\-native or native\-level Japanese proficiency (JLPT N1 equivalent or ACTFL Advanced High).  
* 

Minimum B2\-level English proficiency.  
* 

Comfortable using technology and learning new platforms.  
* 
* Organized, reliable, and able to follow established processes while communicating proactively.

  

  

**This role likely is not the right fit if:**
---------------------------------------------


Your teaching experience is limited to casual conversation practice or informal tutoring.


You have taught primarily children with no adult teaching experience.


You cannot commit to consistent availability.


**Compensation**
----------------


Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, qualifications, and geographic location.


Compensation includes instructional sessions, designated preparation time, required onboarding, and scheduled operational meetings.


**Tech Requirements**
---------------------


To ensure class stability and consistency, all applicants must meet the following:


Windows 10 or 11 (64\-bit) PC


Intel i5\-1135G7 / AMD Ryzen 5 5500U or better


Intel Iris Xe / AMD Vega 7 or better graphics


8GB RAM


10GB free storage


Ethernet connection required with minimum 50 Mbps download / 20 Mbps upload (Wi\-Fi only setups are not supported)


Wired headset with built\-in microphone


**Location \& Eligibility**
---------------------------


We are unable to hire residents of California, Oregon, Massachusetts, Kentucky, Minnesota, Nevada, New Hampshire, or Washington at this time.

**ROLE DESCRIPTION:**

As a reservations and reception team member, we are looking for enthusiastic and proactive individuals who are able to assist in providing memorable experiences for our guest via phone, email and in person. We believe that the biggest factor in the success of a business is the quality of the people. So we work hard to find hospitality\-driven individuals with a great attitude and a thirst for knowledge.

* Professional demeanor and work ethic
* Ability to multitask
* Exceptional guest service
* Responsible for managing and distributing information amongst the team
* Japanese Bilingual Conversational Skills (Preferred, Not Required)
* Japanese Bilingual Written Skills (Preferred, Not Required)

**COMPANY DESCRIPTION:**  
G. LION Hawaii Hospitality Group looks for employees who embody a sense of kindness and empathy, strength and confidence but always with a sense of humility, and an eagerness to learn. If you are interested in joining our growing family, we invite you to send us your resume. We look forward to meeting you!  
**\[glionhawaii.com, @glionhawaii]**

**RESTAURANTS DESCRIPTIONS:**  
At ***Solera***, we are inspired by Hawaii’s unique sense of place and rich, deeply\-rooted flavors while honoring its harmonious blending of global influences. We celebrate the timeless balance of tradition and innovation, creating dishes that honor the past while embracing a forward\-thinking approach.  
\[solerawaikiki.com, @solerawaikiki]

***Quiora*** is also located at The Ritz Carlton. Quiora offers a standard breakfast, lunch, and pool service for the hotel, but their identity lives through dinner, which is Italian\-inspired. It features open\-air dining. At Quiora, the core of our menu revolves around the fresh artisan pastas made by hand every day, along with a beautiful selection of unique entrées, such as seasonal fish and house cut steaks, and Italian classics all perfect for sharing.  
\[quiorawaikiki.com, @quiorawaikiki]

***Hy’s Steak House*** has been a tradition in Waikiki for over forty years and continues to be a favorite with visitors and locals alike. Offering a superb cuisine mix of American, European, Hawaiian and Pacific influences, inclusive of our tableside salad selection and flambe service. Tuxedo required for team members serving on the floor.  
\[hyswaikiki.com, @hyshawaii]

*If you are interested in joining our growing family, we invite you to send us your resume. We look forward to meeting you!*

title: Investment Analyst
description:
**Count on us.** Our "we\-care" culture is more than just a motto; it's a promise. From day one, we prioritize your growth, well\-being, and success. You can count on us to support your career journey and help you achieve your professional goals. Join us.

**Your role.**


Your work will include, but not be limited to:

* Conducting investment due diligence and related research on various investment related topics, including mutual funds, exchange\-traded funds, separately managed accounts, alternative investments, stocks, and bonds.
* Collaborating with other team members to provide sound investment solutions for clients.
* Preparing and interpreting reports to illustrate structural and statistical characteristics of investment portfolios, vehicles, and strategies.
* Engaging regularly with leading money management firms and PMFA’s advisors as part of ongoing due diligence and investment consulting activities.
* Developing research materials and presenting to a variety of committees on topics related to various asset classes, investment vehicles, and economic and capital market conditions.
* Assisting with the development and delivery of analysis, presentations, and commentaries for clients and the public on matters related to the economy, policy, and the capital markets.

**The qualification.**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, or related field required
* 1\-4 years of experience in investment consulting and/or due diligence, financial planning, brokerage or investment management industry required
* Progress toward, or intent to pursue, the CFA designation
* Detail\-oriented leader with strong analytical, problem\-solving, and communication (written and verbal) skills
* Passion for learning and deep interest in the capital markets, economy, and investing
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Excel
* Experience with Morningstar and/or Bloomberg is a plus


This is an exempt position, so you may have to work hours that exceed the standard 40\-hour work week.

**What makes us different?**


On the surface, we’re one of the nation’s largest audit, tax, consulting, and wealth management firms. But dig a little deeper, and you’ll see what makes us different: we’re a relatively jerk\-free firm (hey, nobody ‘s perfect) with a world\-class culture, consistent recognition as one of Fortune Magazine’s “100 Best Companies to Work For,” and an endless array of opportunities. At Plante Moran, diversity, equity and inclusion means that all staff members have equitable and fair opportunities to succeed, in an inclusive environment, with their individual, unique identities. So, what are you waiting for? Apply now.

*Plante Moran enjoys a “Workplace for Your Day” model which, simply put, means we strive for flexibility and balance while staying true to our principally in\-person model. We believe that face\-to\-face interactions are paramount for individual and collective development, but also encourage individuals to work with their supervisor and team to determine their optimal working environment each day.*

*Plante Moran is committed to a diverse workplace. We strive to create a culture where each person feels accepted and valued. We believe that each person’s ultimate potential begins with first acknowledging their inherent dignity. When we can recognize — and celebrate — our many human differences, we’re able to create a workplace where all staff feel a sense of belonging and an opportunity to succeed. This allows us to attract and retain the best talent, serve clients through diverse thinking, and better represent and support the various communities in which we live and work. Plante Moran is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*

*Plante Moran maintains a drug\-free workplace.*

*Interested applicants must submit their resume for consideration using our applicant tracking system. Due to the high volume of interest in our positions, only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted. Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship, with the exception of qualified candidates who are bilingual in either Japanese and English or Chinese and English. Unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies, or similar, will not be paid a fee and become the property of Plante Moran.*

 *The specific statements above are not intended to be all\-inclusive.*


We are pleased to offer eligible staff a robust benefits package. Eligibility and contribution requirements for some of these benefits vary based on the number of hours staff work per week. Highlights include health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. In addition to this, eligible staff are able to take advantage of our Flexible Time Off and various pre\-determined holidays, as well as a 401(k) plan, flexible benefits plans, business\-related travel expense, lodging, and meal reimbursement for business\-related use. A pension plan is also available for eligible administrative and paraprofessional staff. A discretionary bonus plan is available for eligible staff. Plante Moran also offers some contingent staff positions the option to elect health insurance in addition to limited paid sick time.


Compensation information posted is based on a position being located in the state of CO, IL, or MA. Please review the position location for the applicable geographic location. Generally, experienced hires are not hired at or near the maximum salary range for their position, as compensation decisions are determined through a wide variety of factors, including but not limited to: responsibilities, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and geography. For early career roles, including campus hires, we offer market\-based starting salaries that are consistent across individuals within the same hiring group. This approach ensures fairness and reflects current industry benchmarks for entry\-level talent.


Under Colorado’s Job Application Fairness Act, you have the right to redact, from any documents that you submit in connection with your application, information that identifies your age, date of birth, or dates of attendance at or graduation from an educational institution. Should you wish to exercise your right to redact such information, please redact it prior to submitting documentation.


The compensation range for this role in IL, MA or CO is: $73,000\.00\-$97,000\.00

title: Senior Project Engineer
description:
**Senior Project Engineer – Gas Turbine (GT)**

  


**Company Overview**

At Mitsubishi Power, we're not just building better clean energy technologies; we're architecting a better future. Our team is boldly redefining power generation to accelerate the world's energy transition. We operate as one team, pushing toward our vision of the future. We value problem solvers, prioritize collaboration, and support each other in an inclusive culture built on accountability and authenticity by demonstrating our values: Safety, Family, Innovative, Inclusive, Accountable \& Courageous. Together, we’re building the future we all aspire to \- making net zero a reality.  


**Role Overview**

The GT Senior Project Engineer leads the engineering and design team, assuming overall responsibility for successful technical project execution. The GT Senior Project Engineer acts as a liaison between the engineering team, project management and the customer with the responsibility for integrating the various engineering, scheduling, and purchasing aspect of the project in accordance with contract obligations. Familiarity with gas turbine and gas turbine auxiliaries design and construction are required (mechanical, electrical, and I\&C). Familiarity with Steam turbine, Generator, and BOP design and construction is desirable.
**Key Responsibilities**


* Demonstrates our core competencies: Action oriented, change champion, customer\-focused, developing self \& others, and ownership
* Serve as the primary technical point of contact for EPC partners, Owner’s Engineers, and Customers, interpreting and integrating design requirements from customers or parent company in accordance with contract specifications.
* Lead planning, setup, and monitoring of project engineering systems, including kick‑offs, MDLs, DORs, contract deviation lists, and inter‑discipline workflows; coordinate engineering activities and resolve cross‑disciplinary issues.
* Translate contract requirements and scope of work into actionable engineering deliverables for discipline teams, ensuring alignment with contractual obligations.
* Monitor engineering schedules, budgets, and estimates through project completion, including periodic reviews, two‑week look‑ahead planning, expediting activities, escalation of action items, and preparation of technical delivery status reports.
* Support Project Managers and Lead Project Engineers in tracking and assessing design changes, engineering change notices (ECNs), and contract deviations, including impact evaluation.
* Coordinate regularly with international affiliated companies to support successful engineering execution and project delivery.
* Review and comment on project documents and drawings to ensure compliance with contractual document flow and technical requirements.
* Support equipment specification, bid evaluation, vendor selection, and capacity assessments for MPWA‑sourced equipment on Gas Turbine and Combined Cycle projects.
* Maintain working knowledge of applicable engineering codes and standards for combustion turbines and auxiliary systems, including ASME, ANSI, AWS, API, ASTM, NFPA, and NEC.
* Collaborate with Global Sourcing, Quality Assurance, and Project Management to coordinate vendors and subcontractors throughout execution.
* Support Application Engineering in reviewing and evaluating customer specifications in coordination with the parent company, as required.
* Track and resolve open technical and contractual items through project completion and into the warranty period, ensuring closure of outstanding issues.
* Demonstrate strong multitasking and multidisciplinary communication skills across engineering, sourcing, and project teams.

**Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering required; Master’s degree in Engineering preferred.
* 10–20 years of directly related technical experience in engineering or power project execution.
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license preferred.
* Experience with SP3D and other 3D design tools such as SmartPlant or PDMS.
* Knowledge of ISO procedures and OSHA safety requirements.
* International business experience, including collaboration with global teams.
* Proficiency with project management and office tools, including MS Project, Excel, Word, Outlook, Visio, and technical diagrams/flowcharts.
* Strong technical interpretation skills, with the ability to analyze complex instructions presented in mathematical or diagrammatic form and manage both abstract and practical variables.
* Japanese and/or Spanish language fluency is a plus.
* Willingness to travel to customer offices and construction sites as required.

**Why Should You Apply?**


* Excellent Benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision \& 401K Matching).
* Excellent development programs and advancement opportunities.
* Tuition reimbursement and on\-the\-job training.
* Paid vacation, sick time, and holidays.
* Committed to quality products and services.
* Great working environment and culture.
* Employee Appreciation Programs and Event.

  



Mitsubishi Power is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer actively seeking to diversify the workforce and is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. Therefore, all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under applicable law, are strongly encouraged to apply.

title: Office Manager at M&C Tech Indiana
description:
M\&C Tech Indiana in Washington, IN is looking for a Office Manager to join our 55\-person strong team. We are located on 1928 Technology Dr. Our ideal candidate is a self\-starter, punctual, and reliable.

 **Position Overview**


M\&C Tech’s HR/Office Manager will ensure all office and Human Resource, Accounting procedures are completed effectively by directing and supporting staff.

**Essential Job Functions****:**

**Developing and Building Teams**

* Assist team with personnel problems and/or management conflicts
* Advise department managers in personnel matters
* Advise management on labor relation issues
* Recommend action to ensure compliance

**Staffing Organizational Units**

* Develop staffing plan
* Establish and implement recruiting procedures
* Evaluate information from employment interviews
* Ensure HR hiring and onboarding processes are successful
* Maintain job descriptions
* Recommend and guide personnel actions, such as promotions, transfers, and dismissals

**Developing Objectives and Strategies**

* Update policies, procedures, methods, and standards

**Administrative and Accounting**

* Use accounting or bookkeeping software
* AR/AP transaction recording
* Invoice payment
* Updating budget
* Assisting Accountant with book closing
* Account Reconciliation
* Use computers/spreadsheet software to enter, access or retrieve data
* Track and ensure accuracy of time sheet information
* Maintain office and production supply inventory
* Maintain accounting and employee records, reports, or files

 **Knowledge:**


\- Personnel **and Human Resources \-** Knowledge of principles and procedures for personnel recruitment, selection, training, compensation and benefits, labor relations (OSHA, FMLA, EEOC, guidelines and recordkeeping) Unemployment, and personnel information systems.


\- Administration **and Management \-** Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.


\- Psychology **\-** Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; learning and motivation; psychological research methods; and the assessment and treatment of behavioral and affective disorders.


\- Education **and Training \-** Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects.

* ClericalKnowledge of administrative and clerical procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, Excel, designing forms, and other office procedures and terminology.


\- English **Language \-** Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar. Experience with the Japanese language, a plus.

 **Personal/Technical Skills****:**


\- Active **Listening \-** Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.


\- Active **Learning \-** Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem\-solving and decision\-making.


\- Critical **Thinking \-** Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems.


\- Monitoring **\-** Monitoring/Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.


\- Negotiation **\-** Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.


\- Persuasion **\-** Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.


\- Service **Orientation \-** Actively looking for ways to help people.


\- Complex **Problem Solving \-** Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.


\- Management **of Personnel Resources \-** Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.


\- Time **Management \-** Managing one's own time and the time of others.


\- Reading **Comprehension \-** Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work related documents.


\- Speaking **\-** Talking to others to convey information effectively.


\- Writing **\-** Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.


\- Time **Management \-** Managing one's own time and the time of others.


\- Learning **Strategies \-** Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

 **Tasks**

* Administer compensation, benefits and performance management systems, and safety and recreation programs.
* Allocate human resources, ensuring appropriate matches between personnel.
* Perform difficult staffing duties, including dealing with understaffing, refereeing disputes, firing employees, and administering disciplinary procedures.
* Advise managers on organizational policy matters such as equal employment opportunity and sexual harassment and recommend needed changes.
* Analyze and modify compensation and benefits policies to establish competitive programs and ensure compliance with legal requirements.
* Plan, direct, supervise, and coordinate work activities of subordinates and staff relating to employment, compensation, labor, and employee relations. HR and Office staff.
* Analyze training needs to design employee development, language training and health and safety programs.
* Represent organization at personnel\-related hearings and investigations.
* Prepare and follow budgets for personnel operations.
* Oversee the evaluation, classification and rating of occupations and job positions.
* Develop or administer special projects in areas such as pay equity, retention, and employee satisfaction.
* Compile numerical or statistical data
* Supervise bookkeeping, purchase orders, inventories, payroll materials
* Develop job evaluation programs

**Training and Teaching Others**

* Conduct training for all levels of staff
* Develop training programs for Management growth
* Identify training needs
* Participate in staff training programs
* Write employee orientation or training materials

**Administrative Activities**

* Develop records management system
* Develop staff policies
* Develop wage systems for workers
* Direct and coordinate human resource programs
* Fill out insurance forms
* Implement employee benefit plans
* Implement employee compensation plans
* Maintain file of job openings
* Prepare or maintain employee records
* Prepare reports for management

 **Work Conditions****:**

* Open office environment, moderate to loud noise.
* Standard automotive plan environment with PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) such as safety glasses, steel toe shoes, hearing protecting, etc. Personal attire standards may apply.
* Ability to sit, walk or stand for extensive periods of time.
* May occasionally be required to lift 40 pounds.

**Education****:**

* bachelor’s degree in human resources or another related field.
* High School Diploma

 **Experience****:**

* 5 to 8 years of Human Resources experience (education may substitute).
* Injection, extrusion of plastics and Urethane process experience a plus.
* Previous exposure to a multicultural office environment a plus.
* 3 years Accounting Experience preferred (Education may substitute)
* GAAP principal knowledge
* Previous exposure to a multicultural office environment a plus.

  

By applying to this job, you agree to receive periodic text messages from this employer and Homebase about your pending job application. Opt out anytime. Msg \& data rates may apply.  

  

Powered by Homebase. Free employee scheduling, time clock and hiring tools.

title: Customer Engineer
description:
**Company Overview:**

**“Always the Best, Always Fun!”**

DISCO Corporation is a global powerhouse in precision cutting, grinding, and polishing solutions, with a reputation for excellence across the semiconductor, medical devices, and electronic component industries. Headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, we are a forward\-thinking company with a strong presence in 60\+ locations worldwide with a diverse team of 7,000\+ employees. Our success is driven by our core DISCO values that emphasize trust, continuous innovation, and an unwavering commitment to quality. At DISCO, we pride ourselves on fostering an inclusive culture where employees thrive, grow, and contribute to shaping the future of technology. DISCO Corporation’s U.S affiliate, DISCO Hi\-Tec America, Inc. (DHA), is looking to expand our Equipment Engineering/Field Service Engineering team! We are currently people who bring fresh perspectives, new ideas, and unique skills to join us as a **Field Service Engineer** in the **Chandler, AZ** area.

**Position Title**: Field Service Engineer

**Position Location**: This position will require **60 %** travel between our office in Chandler, AZ and customer sites.

**Key Responsibilities:**

After training period, you should be able to:

* Install, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair DISCO grinding, dicing, and laser equipment at customer sites, ensuring top\-tier performance and customer satisfaction. Independently diagnose complex issues through rigorous electrical/mechanical procedural sequences.
* Document analytical steps and root causes for internal teams and customers.
* Foster strong customer relationships to provide reliable support onsite and offsite, including possible training of customers' personnel in servicing, maintenance, and operations of DISCO products.
* Assist with translating technical materials and communicating with headquarters in Japan in Japanese.
* Work with cutting\-edge robotics, cameras, electrical motor components, and sophisticated software.
* Participate in DISCO corporate activities focusing on deeper thinking, value exchange, and constant improvement.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Preferred Experience and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor of Science degree in any discipline preferred.
* Strong aptitude for electro\-mechanical repair, with the ability to troubleshoot and fix intricate systems.
* Familiarity with lab instrumentation, CAD drawings, electrical diagrams, MS Office, and general computer programming.
* Knowledge of semiconductor processes, lasers fundamentals, optics fundamentals, or semiconductor industrial engineering and operation is a plus.
* 2\-4 years of applicable working experience or hands\-on experience with similar technical field (HVAC, Automotive, etc) is ideal.
* Military experiences are welcome.
* Bilingual (Korean, Chinese, Japanese, Spanish) is a plus.

**Physical Requirements:**

* Lift and move up to 30 lbs. and work in varied physical positions to access hard\-to reach areas on our equipment.
* Wear personal protective gear for extended periods during on\-site work.

**Interpersonal Skills:**

* Clear, concise, and effective communication skills to interact with colleagues, customers, and leadership.
* A high degree of self\-motivation and creativity, with the ability to perform under pressure, even in challenging situations.
* A natural ability to build strong relationships, maintaining trust and teamwork within a global company, building upon DISCO’s culture to help build an inclusive work environment.
* Willingness to lead peers on projects and act as a resource for colleagues.

**"We are not accepting unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies."**

**DISCO Hi\-Tec America, Inc. is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and diversity in its workforce without discrimination.**

**Benefits**

* Great bonus and recognition programs
* Generous paid time off and holidays
* Health Insurance
* Health Savings Account
* Vision Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Life Insurance
* 401(k) with matching
* Tuition Support
* Relocation Assistance

Job Type: Full\-time

Pay: $50,000\.00 \- $65,000\.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Language:

* Korean (Required)
* Chinese (Required)
* Japanese (Required)
* Spanish (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Audit Staff
description:

* 401(k)
* Bonus based on performance
* Company parties
* Competitive salary
* Dental insurance

* Paid time off
